parameters.name: { typeCheck, manifest, animations, src, fileName, shouldDownload = true }

members.name: _playerState
members.default:
{
            prev: PlayerState.Loading,
            count: 0,
            loaded: false,
            visible: false,
            scrollY: 0,
            scrollTimeout: null
        }

members.name: animateOnScroll
members.description: Whether to trigger next frame with scroll

members.name: multiAnimationSettings
members.description:
Multi-animation settings
If set, these will override conflicting settings

members.name: renderer
members.description: Renderer to use (svg, canvas or html)

members.name: _currentAnimation
members.description: Which animation to show, if several

members.name: _animations
members.description:
This is set to state, so that next-button will show up
on load, if controls are visible

members.name: _playerState

type.text:
{
    prev: PlayerState
    count: number
    loaded: boolean
    visible: boolean
    scrollY: number
    scrollTimeout: NodeJS.Timeout | null
  }

members.default:
{
    prev: PlayerState.Loading,
    count: 0,
    loaded: false,
    visible: false,
    scrollY: 0,
    scrollTimeout: null
  }

parameters.name: src
parameters.description: URL to lottie animation, or raw JSON data

members.name: _handleSeekChange
members.description: Handles click and drag actions on the progress track

members.name: addAnimation

parameters.name: shouldDownload
parameters.description:
Whether to trigger a download in the browser.
If set to false the function returns an ArrayBuffer. Defaults to true.

members.description: Creates a new dotLottie file, by combinig several animations

members.name: getLottie
members.description: Returns the lottie-web instance used in the component

members.name: snapshot
members.description: Snapshot and download the current frame as SVG

members.name: setSubframe
members.description: Toggles subframe, for more smooth animations

members.name: _freeze
members.description:
Freeze animation.
This internal state pauses animation and is used to differentiate between
user requested pauses and component instigated pauses.

parameters.name:
{
    typeCheck,
    manifest,
    animations,
    src,
    fileName,
    shouldDownload = true
  }

members.name: styles
members.description: Return the styles for the component
